channel.title: Senior Member Title
channel.description:
I've been on this website since August 06, 2006. Just wondering if there is a type of tag besides "member" that is available for us long term users.
Appreciate any response.

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:20, topic:546629”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=665526.msg4449277#msg4449277 date=1410428279]

I think it’s good that we did away with Senior Member, Moparian, etc. If you want to be treated with the reverence and held in high esteem then let it be because you’re known for doing something - not because you’ve been sitting on your arse for eight years and some people haven’t.
[/quote]They were titles specifically renamed to indicate they were nothing more than a simple ruler for post count. It’s a bit ridiculous that anyone would consider that high esteem. Now we can’t see post count indicators or specific values at all. If anything, that makes registration date more “esteem” than ever, because we cant see if someone has actually been posting in those 8 years of if they have just been ‘sitting on their arse’. That’s some backwards logic.

You’ve made 22,375 posts at the time I wrote this reply.

The people who matter have reputations that precede them, and these reputations are entirely removed from notions such as post counts, website usage, or account age. Silabsoft would be one example. Semaphore was another when he was around.[/quote]Ridiculous. Silabsoft wasn’t any less famous when post count was visible or the Moparian title existed. People that have a reputation have it for a reason, and being able to see how many posts someone has made doesn’t effect that at all. There are plenty of people people here with a reputation that didn’t (or barely did) have the Moparian title. peterbjornx, discardedx2, etc, all came with contributions and within their first 20 posts had their reputation. It’s apples and oranges you are comparing. Post count was never an indicator of reputation.

EDIT - Also, wasn’t it you that made the initial push to hide the Vet rank? My memory may not be serving me well, but if it’s true, doesn’t that also contract what you are saying here? You say these simple post based titles take away the esteem and reputation from people that deserve it, but the very definition of of that rank was making said people visible who had earned the title.

Read full topic

Don’t judge a book by it’s cover, Nuff’ said;

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:18, topic:546629”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=665526.msg4449273#msg4449273 date=1410420598]
I think it’s good that we did away with Senior Member, Moparian, etc. If you want to be treated with the reverence and held in high esteem then let it be because you’re known for doing something - not because you’ve been sitting on your arse for eight years and some people haven’t.
[/quote]They were titles specifically renamed to indicate they were nothing more than a simple ruler for post count. It’s a bit ridiculous that anyone would consider that high esteem. Now we can’t see post count indicators or specific values at all. If anything, that makes registration date more “esteem” than ever, because we cant see if someone has actually been posting in those 8 years of if they have just been ‘sitting on their arse’. That’s some backwards logic.[/quote]
You’ve made 22,375 posts at the time I wrote this reply.

The people who matter have reputations that precede them, and these reputations are entirely removed from notions such as post counts, website usage, or account age. Silabsoft would be one example. Semaphore was another when he was around.

Read full topic

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @DemonWars DemonWars
item.description:
@DemonWars wrote:

I think it’s a good idea to remove most ranks, but i think people who have done work that you can actually call work instead of making just another 317 (sorry but those just iritate me personally and my statement shouldn’t be taken as a official argument)
I mean, nearly everyone knows Davidi2 here.
But i was thinking…
Someone who posted alot in the model section and has some adored model work, could get the rank "modeler"
Someone who posted alot of adored servers (with creative and new work) could be ranked "Coder"
And variants for people who have been actively doing it for 5+ years like "Veteran Coder"
Or fun ranks for coders that work on a specific revision, like “317 junkie” that kind of stuff.

I get that some level of profesionality is needed, but ranks make the forums more personal.
And a bit of compitition is healthy.

Anyway, those are my ideas.

Kind regards.
DemonWars.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“wetodded, post:3, topic:546629”]Lol.
Well, my name is lower-cased… which now I would never do… under any circumstances.
So if there was a “Senior Member” underneath, maybe I wouldn’t feel like such a noob. ^_^[/quote]
Someone get this man a damn uppercase name or I’m going to lose it.

Read full topic

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Davidi2:

Moparian*, which is still what the OP meant by not having Member under his name. But a quick glance makes it look like that was removed as well? When did that happen? I remember a discussion about changing the post count requirements for those ranks but I can’t remember one about removing them completely. Link?

Everyone is a “Member” now, there is no Senior Member, Moparian, etc

Read full topic

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I can’t remember if there was a discussion, you expressed you weren’t aware about it a while back in another topic. Regardless, as far as this topic is concerned there is no Moparian/Senior Member rank.

Tom:

There is no senior member rank that’s based on your post count anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

We don’t have any ranks that are based solely on registration date. We have other groups (such as veteran) that aren’t visible and require a nomination and a voting process.

Read full topic

item.title: Senior Member Title
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Message Tom about getting Community Member status. Seeing as you’ve been here for so long you should get it, just let him know your registration date.

Read full topic
